sentence: Speaker, I strongly oppose all three of these  Congressional Review Act resolutions on the floor because the reality  is that these would overhaul years of public input.

sentence: Speaker, I strongly oppose this undemocratic and paternalistic  bill, which amends D.C.

sentence: Speaker, I strongly oppose this unprecedented, undemocratic, and  paternalistic disapproval resolution.

sentence: Speaker, I strongly oppose this resolution for both the extreme  danger that it poses to the Boundary Waters and the outrageous abuse of  the Congressional Review Act that it represents.
title: Providing for Congressional Disapproval of the Rule Submitted By the Bureau of Land Management Relating to Public Land Order No. 7917 for Withdrawal of Federal Lands; Cook, Lake, and Saint Louis Counties, Mn

sentence: Madam Speaker, I strongly oppose this antidemocratic  bill, which would repeal provisions of a law enacted by the locally  elected District of Columbia Government.
title: Protecting Our Nation's Capital Emergency Act

sentence: Speaker, I strongly oppose this bill, which would overrule rules  implemented by D.C.'s elected leaders on when Metropolitan Police  officers should pursue a fleeing car.
title: District of Columbia Policing Protection Act

sentence:

sentence: Speaker, I strongly oppose this undemocratic, anti- immigrant bill, which would nullify laws, policies, and practices  enacted by the locally elected District of Columbia Government.

sentence: Speaker, I strongly oppose this resolution,  which limits the United States' ability to fight narcoterrorist  traffickers in our own hemisphere, where we are most directly impacted.
title: Resolution, to Remove United States Armed Forces From Hostilities with Presidentially Designated Terrorist Organizations in the Western Hemisphere
